body_html:
I agree the existing language is confusing, but the updated language is also difficult to parse. I think the example you gave is much clearer. Should we put that there instead? Something like:

For rank > 2:

A = tf.constant(..., shape=[a, ..., z, p, x])
B = tf.constant(..., shape=[a', ..., z', x', q]) 
C = tf.matmul(A, B)

The outer dimensions a, ..., z must be identical to a', ..., z', and x and x' must match.

For rank > 2:
A = tf.constant(..., shape=[a, ..., z, p, x])
B = tf.constant(..., shape=[a', ..., z', x', q]) 
C = tf.matmul(A, B)

The outer dimensions a, ..., z must be identical to a', ..., z', and x and x' must match.
body:
I agree the existing language is confusing, but the updated language is also difficult to parse. I think the example you gave is much clearer. Should we put that there instead? Something like:

For rank > 2:
```
A = tf.constant(..., shape=[a, ..., z, p, x])
B = tf.constant(..., shape=[a', ..., z', x', q]) 
C = tf.matmul(A, B)
```
The outer dimensions a, ..., z must be identical to a', ..., z', and x and x' must match.
